summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In my first book, Theophilus, I wrote about everything Jesus did and taught from the beginning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: up to the day when he was taken up to heaven after giving orders by the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had suffered, he had shown himself alive to them by many convincing proofs, appearing to them during a period of 40 days and telling them about the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was meeting with them, he ordered them, “Don’t leave Jerusalem. Instead, wait for what the Father has promised, about which you heard me speak,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit a few days from now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who had gathered together began to ask Jesus, “Lord, is this the time when you will restore the kingdom to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “It isn’t for you to know what times or periods the Father has fixed by his own authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you’ll receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you, and you’ll be my witnesses in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, Jesus was taken up while those who had gathered together were watching, and a cloud took him out of their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was going and they were gazing up toward heaven, two men in white robes stood right beside them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked, “Men of Galilee, why do you stand looking up toward heaven? This same Jesus, who has been taken up from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you saw him go up into heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came into the city, these men went to the upstairs room where they had been staying: Peter and John, James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With one mind, all of them kept devoting themselves to prayer, along with the women (including Mary the mother of Jesus) and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, Peter got up among the brothers (there were about 120 people present) and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brothers, the Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke long ago through the voice of David about Judas, who was the guide for those who arrested Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was one of our number and was appointed to share in this ministry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now this man bought a field with the money he got for his crime. Falling on his face, he burst open in the middle, and all his intestines gushed out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This became known to all the residents of Jerusalem, so that this field is called in their language Hakeldama, that is, “The Field of Blood”.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For in the Book of Psalms it is written, ‘Let his estate be desolate, and let no one live on it,’ and, ‘Let someone else take over his office,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was one of the men associated with us all the time the Lord Jesus came and went among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beginning when he was baptized by John until the day he was taken up from us. Therefore, someone like this must become a witness with us to his resurrection.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they nominated two men—Joseph called Barsabbas, who also was called Justus, and Matthias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they prayed, “Lord, you know the hearts of all people. Show us which one of these two men you have chosen
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to serve in this office of apostle, from which Judas left to go to his own place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they drew lots for them, and when the lot fell on Matthias, he was enrolled with the eleven apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day of Pentecost was being celebrated, all of them were together in one place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a sound like the roar of a mighty windstorm came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They saw tongues like flames of fire that separated, and one rested on each of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in foreign languages as the Spirit gave them that ability.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now devout Jews from every nation on earth were living in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When that sound came, a crowd quickly gathered, startled because each one heard the disciples speaking in his own language.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stunned and amazed, they asked, “All of these people who are speaking are Galileans, aren’t they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So how is it that each one of us hears them speaking in his own native language:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, residents of Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the district of Libya near Cyrene, Jewish and proselyte visitors from Rome,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cretans, and Arabs, listening to them talk in our own languages about the great deeds of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them continued to be stunned and puzzled, and they kept asking one another, “What can this mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others kept saying in derision, “They’re drunk on sweet wine!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Peter stood up among the eleven apostles and raised his voice to address them:
“Men of Judea and everyone living in Jerusalem! You must understand something, so pay close attention to my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These men are not drunk as you suppose, for it’s only nine o’clock in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘In the last days, God says,
    I will pour out my Spirit on everyone.
Your sons and your daughters will prophesy,
    your young men will see visions,
        and your old men will dream dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days I will even pour out my Spirit
    on my slaves, men and women alike,
        and they will prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will display wonders in the sky above
    and signs on the earth below:
        blood, fire, and clouds of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun will become dark,
    and the moon turn to blood,
        before the coming of the great and glorious Day of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Fellow Israelis, listen to these words: Jesus from Nazareth was a man authenticated to you by God through miracles, wonders, and signs that God performed through him among you, as you yourselves know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he was arrested according to the predetermined plan and foreknowledge of God, you crucified this very man and killed him using the hands of lawless men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised him up, putting an end to the suffering of death, since it was impossible for him to be held by it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
since David says about him,
‘I always keep my eyes on the Lord,
    for he is at my right hand
        so that I cannot be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why my heart is glad
    and my tongue rejoices,
        yes, even my body still rests securely in hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you will not abandon my soul to Hades
    or allow your Holy One to experience decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made the ways of life known to me,
    and you will fill me with gladness in your presence.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brothers, I can tell you confidently that the patriarch David died and was buried, and that his tomb is among us to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since he was a prophet and knew that God had promised him with an oath to put one of his descendants on his throne,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he looked ahead and spoke about the resurrection of the Messiah:
‘He was not abandoned to Hades,
    and his flesh did not experience decay.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It was this very Jesus whom God raised—and we’re all witnesses of that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has been exalted to the right hand of God, has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit, and has caused you to experience what you are seeing and hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After all, David did not go up to heaven, but he said,
‘The Lord told my Lord,
    “Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make your enemies your footstool.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, let all the people of Israel understand beyond a doubt that God made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Messiah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowd that had gathered heard this, they were pierced to the heart. They asked Peter and the other apostles, “Brothers, what should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered them, “Every one of you must repent and be baptized in the name of Jesus the Messiah for the forgiveness of your sins. Then you will receive the Holy Spirit as a gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this promise belongs to you and your children, as well as to all those who are distant, whom the Lord our God may call to himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Using many different expressions, Peter continued to testify and to plead: “Be saved,” he urged them, “from this corrupt generation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who welcomed his message were baptized. That day about 3,000 people were added to their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The believers continued to devote themselves to what the apostles were teaching, to fellowship, to the breaking of bread, and to times of prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sense of fear came over everyone, and many wonders and signs were being done by the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the believers were united and shared everything with one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made it their practice to sell their possessions and goods and to distribute the proceeds to anyone who was in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: United in purpose, they went to the Temple every day, ate at each other’s homes, and shared their food with glad and humble hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were praising God and enjoying the good will of all the people. Every day the Lord was adding to their number those who were being saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One afternoon, Peter and John were on their way to the Temple for the three o’clock prayer time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man who had been crippled from birth was being carried in. Every day people would lay him at what was called the Beautiful Gate so that he could beg from those who were going into the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw that Peter and John were about to go into the Temple, he asked them to give him something.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, along with John, looked him straight in the eye and said, “Look at us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man watched them closely, expecting to get something from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Peter said, “I don’t have any silver or gold, but I’ll give you what I do have. In the name of Jesus the Messiah from Nazareth, walk!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter took hold of his right hand and began to help him up. Immediately his feet and ankles became strong,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sprang to his feet, stood up, and began to walk. Then he went with them into the Temple, walking, jumping, and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people saw him walking and praising God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they knew that he was the man who used to sit and beg at the Beautiful Gate of the Temple, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was holding on to Peter and John, all the people came running to them in what was called “Solomon’s Colonnade”. They were dumbfounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter saw this, he told the people: “Fellow Israelis, why are you wondering about this, and why are you staring at us as if by our own power or godliness we made him walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—the God of our ancestors—has glorified his servant Jesus, whom you betrayed and rejected in the presence of Pilate, even though he had decided to let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You rejected the Holy and Righteous One and asked to have a murderer released to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you killed the source of life, whom God raised from the dead. We are witnesses to that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is his name—that is, by faith in his name—that has healed this man whom you see and know. Yes, the faith that comes through Jesus has given him this perfect health in the presence of all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance like your leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how God fulfilled what he had predicted through the voice of all the prophets—that his Messiah would suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, repent and turn to him to have your sins blotted out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord and so that he may send you Jesus, whom he appointed long ago to be the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must remain in heaven until the time of universal restitution, which God announced long ago through the voice of his holy prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In fact, Moses said,
‘The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers. You must listen to everything he tells you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any person who will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Indeed, all the prophets who have spoken, from Samuel and those who followed him, also announced these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the descendants of the prophets and the heirs of the covenant that God made with your ancestors when he told Abraham, ‘Through your descendant all the families of the earth will be blessed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When God raised up his servant, he sent him first to you to bless you by turning every one of you from your evil ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were speaking to the people, the priests, the commander of the Temple guards, and the Sadducees came to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were greatly disturbed that Peter and John were teaching the people and announcing that Jesus had been resurrected from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they arrested them and placed them in custody until the next day, since it was already evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many of those who heard their message believed, and the men grew to number about 5,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, their rulers, elders, and scribes met in Jerusalem
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with Annas the high priest, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and the rest of the high priest’s family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made Peter and John stand in front of them and began asking, “By what power or by what name did you do this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, told them, “Rulers and elders of the people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we are being questioned today for a good deed done for someone who was sick or to learn how this man was healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you and all the people of Israel must understand that this man stands healthy before you because of the name of Jesus from Nazareth, whom you crucified, but whom God raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is
‘the stone that was rejected by you builders,
    which has become the cornerstone.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no salvation by anyone else, for there is no other name under heaven given among people by which we must be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Jewish leaders saw the boldness of Peter and John and found out that they were uneducated and ordinary men, they were amazed and realized that they had been with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they could not say anything against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they ordered them to leave the Council and began to discuss the matter among themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “What should we do with these men? For it’s obvious to everybody living in Jerusalem that an unmistakable sign has been done by them, and we cannot deny it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to keep it from spreading any further among the people, let us warn them never again to speak to anyone in this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they called Peter and John back in and ordered them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and John answered them, “You must decide whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we cannot stop talking about what we’ve seen and heard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they threatened Peter and John even more and then let them go. They couldn’t find any way to punish them, because all the people were praising God for what had happened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since the man on whom this sign of healing had been performed was more than 40 years old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they were released, Peter and John went to their fellow believers and told them everything the high priests and the elders had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they all raised their voices to God and said, “Master, you made heaven and earth, the sea, and everything in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You said by the Holy Spirit through the voice of our ancestor, your servant David,
‘Why do the unbelievers rage,
    and the people devise useless plots?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth take their stand,
    and rulers meet together against the Lord
        and against his Messiah.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this city both Herod and Pontius Pilate actually met together with unbelievers and the people of Israel to oppose your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to carry out everything that your hand and will had predetermined to take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, pay attention to their threats now, and allow your servants to speak your word boldly
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as you stretch out your hand to heal and to perform signs and wonders through the name of your holy servant Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had prayed, the place where they were meeting was shaken, and all of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and continued to speak messages from God boldly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the believers were one in heart and soul, and nobody called any of his possessions his own. Instead, they shared everything they owned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With great power, the apostles continued to testify to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and abundant grace was on them all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since none of them needed anything, because everyone who had land or houses would sell them and bring the money received for the things sold
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lay it at the apostles’ feet. Then it was distributed to anyone who needed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One man, Joseph, a descendant of Levi and a native of Cyprus, who was named Barnabas by the apostles (the name means “a son of encouragement”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sold a field that belonged to him, brought the money, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But then a man named Ananias, with the consent of his wife Sapphira, sold some property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With his wife’s full knowledge, he kept back some of the money for himself and brought the remainder and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter asked, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart so that you should lie to the Holy Spirit and keep back some of the money you got for the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as it remained unsold, wasn’t it your own? And after it was sold, wasn’t the money at your disposal? So how could you have thought of doing what you did? You didn’t lie only to men, but also to God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Ananias heard these words, he fell down and died. And great fear seized everyone who heard about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young men got up, wrapped him up, carried him outside, and buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After an interval of about three hours, Ananias’ wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Peter asked her, “Tell me, did you sell the land for that price?”
She answered, “Yes, that was the price.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How could you have agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord?” Peter asked her. “Listen! The feet of the men who buried your husband are at the door, and these men will carry you outside as well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She instantly fell down at Peter’s feet and died. When the young men came in, they found her dead. So they carried her out and buried her next to her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great fear seized the whole church and everyone else who heard about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now many signs and wonders were being performed by the apostles among the people, who were gathered together in Solomon’s Colonnade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the others dared join them, although the rest of the people continued to hold them in high regard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, believers were being added to the Lord in increasing numbers—both men and women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, people kept carrying their sick into the streets and placing them on stretchers and mats so that at least Peter’s shadow might fall on some of them as he went by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crowds continued coming in—even from the towns around Jerusalem—bringing their sick and those who were troubled by unclean spirits, and all of them were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest and all those from the sect of the Sadducees who were with him were filled with jealousy. So they went out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: arrested the apostles, and put them in the city jail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at night the angel of the Lord opened the prison doors and led them out. The angel told them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, stand in the Temple, and keep on telling the people the whole message about this life they can have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the apostles heard this, they went into the Temple at daybreak and began to teach. The high priest and those who were with him arrived, called the Council and all the elders of Israel together, and sent word to the prison to have the men brought in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Temple police got there, they did not find them in the prison. They came back and reported,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We found the prison securely locked and the guards standing at the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the commander of the Temple guards and the high priests heard these words, they were utterly at a loss as to what could have happened to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then someone came and told them, “Look! The men you put in prison are standing in the Temple and teaching the people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the commander of the Temple guards went with his men to bring them back without force, because they were afraid of being stoned to death by the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they brought them back, they made them stand before the Council, and the high priest began to question them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “We gave you strict orders not to teach in his name, didn’t we? Yet you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and are determined to bring this man’s blood on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of our ancestors raised Jesus to life after you killed him by hanging him on a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has exalted to his right hand this very man as our Leader and Savior in order to extend repentance and forgiveness of sins to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who keep on obeying him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Council heard this, they became furious and wanted to kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the Law who was respected by all the people, stood up in the Council and ordered the men to be taken outside for a little while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “Fellow Israelis, consider carefully what you propose to do to these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the recent past Theudas appeared, claiming that he was important, and about 400 men joined him. He was killed, and all his followers were dispersed and disappeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that man, at the time of the census, Judas the Galilean appeared and got people to follow him. He, too, died, and all his followers were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m telling you to keep away from these men for now. Leave them alone, because if this plan or movement is of human origin, it will fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
However, if it’s from God, you won’t be able to stop them, and you may even discover that you are fighting against God!”
So they were convinced by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After calling in the apostles and beating them, they again ordered them to stop speaking in the name of Jesus and let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left the Council, rejoicing to have been considered worthy to suffer dishonor for the sake of the Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day in the Temple and from house to house they kept teaching and proclaiming that Jesus is the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, as the number of the disciples was growing larger and larger, a complaint was made by the Hellenistic Jews against the Hebraic Jews that their widows were being neglected in the daily distribution of food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Twelve called the whole group of disciples together and said, “It is not desirable for us to neglect messages from God in order to wait on tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brothers, appoint seven men among you who have a good reputation, who are full of the Spirit and wisdom, and we’ll put them in charge of this work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we’ll devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This suggestion pleased the whole group. So they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a gentile convert to Judaism from Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had these men stand before the apostles, who prayed and laid their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the word of God continued to spread, and the number of disciples in Jerusalem continued to grow rapidly. Even a large number of priests became obedient to the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Stephen, full of grace and power, was performing great wonders and signs among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some men who belonged to the Synagogue of the Freedmen (as it was called), as well as some Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and men from Cilicia and Asia, stood up and began to debate with Stephen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they could neither refute the wisdom nor withstand the Spirit by which he kept speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they secretly got some men to say, “We have heard him speaking blasphemous words against Moses and God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes. Then they rushed at Stephen, grabbed him, and brought him before the Council.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had false witnesses stand up and say, “This man never stops saying things against this Holy Place and against the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have heard him say that this Jesus from Nazareth will destroy this place and change the customs that Moses handed down to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then everyone who was seated in the Council glared at him and saw that his face was like the face of an angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest asked, “Is this true?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stephen replied:
“Listen, brothers and fathers!
“The glorious God appeared to our ancestor Abraham while he was in Mesopotamia before he settled in Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God told him, ‘Leave your country and your relatives and go to the land I’ll show you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he left the country of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran. Then after the death of his father, God had him move to this country where you now live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God gave him no property here, not even a foot of land, yet he promised to give it to him and to his descendants after him as a permanent possession, even though he had no child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what God promised: His descendants would be strangers in a foreign country, and its people would enslave them and oppress them for 400 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But I will punish the nation they serve,’ said God, ‘and afterwards they will leave and worship me in this place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, God gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision. Later, he fathered Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day. Then Isaac fathered Jacob, and Jacob fathered the twelve patriarchs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Joseph’s brothers became jealous of him and sold Joseph as a slave in Egypt. However, God was with him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rescued him from all his troubles. He granted him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who appointed him ruler of Egypt and of his whole household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But a famine spread throughout Egypt and Canaan, and with it great suffering, and our ancestors couldn’t find any food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our ancestors on their first trip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On their second trip, Joseph made himself known to his brothers, and Joseph introduced his family to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph invited his father Jacob and all his relatives to come to him in Egypt—75 persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob went down to Egypt. Then he and our ancestors died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were brought back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham had bought at a high price from Hamor’s descendants in Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now as the time approached for the fulfillment of the promise that God had made to Abraham, the people’s population increased a great deal in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eventually, a different king who had not known Joseph became ruler of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By shrewdly scheming against our people, he oppressed our ancestors and forced them to abandon their infants to the elements, so that they wouldn’t live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At this time Moses was born. He was beautiful in the sight of God, and for three months he was cared for in his father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was placed outside, Pharaoh’s daughter adopted him and brought him up as her own son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses learned all the wisdom of the Egyptians and became a great man, both in words and in deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he was 40 years old, he decided to visit his brothers, the descendants of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw one of them being mistreated, he defended him and avenged the man who was being mistreated by killing the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He supposed that his brothers would understand that God was using him to rescue them, but they didn’t understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, he presented himself to some of them while they were fighting and tried to reconcile them. He said, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why should you be hurting another?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the man who was harming his neighbor pushed Moses away and said, ‘Who made you ruler and judge over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You don’t want to kill me like you killed the Egyptian yesterday, do you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this, Moses fled and lived as a foreigner in the land of Midian. There he had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After 40 years had passed, an angel appeared to him in the flames of a burning bush in the desert near Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses saw it, he was amazed at the sight, and when he approached the bush to look at it, the voice of the Lord said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of your ancestors—the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.’ Moses became terrified and didn’t dare to look.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told him, ‘Remove your sandals from your feet, because the place where you are standing is holy ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have surely seen the oppression of my people in Egypt, I’ve heard their groans, and I’ve come down to rescue them. Now come, I’ll send you to Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This same Moses—whom they rejected by saying, ‘Who made you ruler and judge?’—was the man whom God sent to be both their ruler and deliverer with the help of the angel who had appeared to him in the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was he who led them out, performing wonders and signs in Egypt, at the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for 40 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was this Moses who told the Israelis, ‘God will raise up a prophet for you from among your own brothers, just as he did me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Moses is the one who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai and to our ancestors. He received living truths to give to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but our ancestors refused to obey him. Instead, they rejected him and wished to return to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told Aaron, ‘Make gods for us who will lead us. This Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt—we don’t know what happened to him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time they even made a calf to be their idol, offered a sacrifice to it, and delighted in what they had made with their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So God turned away from them and gave them over to worship the heavenly bodies. As it is written in the book of the Prophets:
‘O house of Israel,
    you didn’t offer me slaughtered animals and
        sacrifices those 40 years in the wilderness, did you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You even took along the tent of Moloch,
    the star of your god Rephan,
and the images you made in order to worship them.
    So I will take you into exile as far as Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our ancestors had the Tent of Testimony in the wilderness constructed, just as the one who spoke to Moses directed him to make it according to the pattern he had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our ancestors brought it here with Joshua when they replaced the nations that God drove out in front of our ancestors, and it was here until the time of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He found favor with God and asked to design a dwelling for the house of Jacob,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but it was Solomon who built a house for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the Most High does not live in buildings made by human hands. As the prophet says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Heaven is my throne,
    and the earth is my footstool.
What kind of house can you build for me,’ declares the Lord,
    “or what place is there in which I can rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was my hand that made all these things, wasn’t it?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You stubborn people with uncircumcised hearts and ears! You are always opposing the Holy Spirit, just as your ancestors used to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of the prophets did your ancestors fail to persecute? They killed those who predicted the coming of the Righteous One, and now you have become his betrayers and murderers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You received the Law as ordained by angels, and yet you haven’t obeyed it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were listening to these things, they became more and more furious and began to grind their teeth at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Stephen, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked straight into heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Look! I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shouted out loud, stopped listening, and together they all rushed at him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ran him outside of the city, and began to stone him to death. Meanwhile, the witnesses laid their coats at the feet of a young man named Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they continued to stone Stephen, he kept praying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he knelt down and cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, don’t hold this sin against them!” After he had said this, he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Saul heartily approved of putting Stephen to death. That day a severe persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem, and everyone except for the apostles was scattered throughout the countryside of Judea and Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Devout men buried Stephen as they mourned loudly for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul kept trying to destroy the church. Going into one house after another, he began dragging off men and women and throwing them in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who were scattered went from place to place preaching the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and began to preach the Messiah to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowds, hearing his message and seeing the signs that he was doing, paid close attention to what was said by Philip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unclean spirits screamed with a loud voice as they came out of the many people they had possessed, and many paralyzed and lame people were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, there was great rejoicing in that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in that city there was a man named Simon. He was practicing occult arts and thrilling the people of Samaria, claiming to be someone great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone from the least to the greatest paid close attention to him, saying, “This is what we call the great power of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They paid careful attention to him because he had thrilled them for a long time with his occult performances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Philip proclaimed the good news about the kingdom of God and about the name of Jesus the Messiah, men and women believed and were baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even Simon believed, and after he was baptized he became devoted to Philip. He was amazed to see the signs and great miracles that were happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaritans had accepted the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went down and prayed for them to receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before this, he had not come on any of them. They had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter and John laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Give me this power too, so that when I lay my hands on someone, he will receive the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter told him, “May your money perish with you, because you thought you could obtain God’s free gift with money!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have no part or share in what we’re saying, because your heart isn’t right with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So repent of this wickedness of yours, and pray to the Lord that, if possible, your heart’s intent may be forgiven you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I see that you’re being poisoned by bitterness and you’re a prisoner of wickedness!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered, “Both of you pray to the Lord for me that none of the things you have said will happen to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had given their testimony and spoken the word of the Lord, they started back to Jerusalem, continuing to proclaim the good news in many Samaritan villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an angel of the Lord told Philip, “Get up and go south on the road that leads from Jerusalem to Gaza. This is a deserted road.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got up and went. Now there was an Ethiopian eunuch, who was a member of the court of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians. He was in charge of all her treasures and had come up to Jerusalem to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was returning home, seated in his chariot, and reading from the prophet Isaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit told Philip, “Approach that chariot and stay near it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Philip ran up to it and heard him reading the prophet Isaiah out loud.
Philip asked, “Do you understand what you’re reading?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied, “How can I unless someone guides me?” So he invited Philip to get in and sit with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This was the passage of Scripture he was reading:
“Like a sheep he was led away to be slaughtered,
    and like a lamb is silent before its shearer,
        so he does not open his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his humiliation, justice was denied him.
    Who can describe his descendants?
        For his life is taken away from the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eunuch asked Philip, “I ask you, who is the prophet talking about? Himself? Or someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip began to speak, and, starting from this Scripture, he told him the good news about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were going along the road, they came to some water. The eunuch said, “Look, there’s some water. What keeps me from being baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he ordered the chariot to stop, and Philip and the eunuch both went down into the water, and Philip baptized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away. The eunuch went on his way rejoicing and did not see Philip again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Philip found himself at Azotus. As he was passing through that region, he kept proclaiming the good news in all the towns until he came to Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, still spewing death threats against the Lord’s disciples, Saul went to the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked him for letters to take with him to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any men or women belonging to the Way, he might bring them in chains to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Saul traveled along and was approaching Damascus, a light from heaven suddenly flashed around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He dropped to the ground and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul! Why are you persecuting me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked, “Who are you, Lord?”
The voice said, “I’m Jesus, whom you are persecuting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now get up, go into the city, and you will be told what you are to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the men who were traveling with Saul were standing speechless, for they heard the voice but didn’t see anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul got up off the ground, he couldn’t see anything, even though his eyes were open. So his companions took him by the hand and led him into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For three days he couldn’t see, and he didn’t eat or drink anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now in Damascus there was a disciple named Ananias. The Lord called out to him in a vision, “Ananias!”
He answered, “Here I am, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told him, “Get up, go to the street called Straight, and in the home of Judas look for a man from Tarsus named Saul. At this very moment he’s praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has seen in a vision a man named Ananias come in and lay his hands on him so he would see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard many people tell how much evil this man has done to your saints in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is here with authority from the high priests to put in chains all who call on your name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord told him, “Go, because he’s my chosen instrument to carry my name to unbelievers, to their kings, and to the descendants of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since I’m going to show him how much he must suffer for my name’s sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ananias left and went to that house. He laid his hands on Saul and said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you were traveling, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All at once something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes, and he could see again.
He got up and was baptized,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after eating some food, he felt strong again. For several days he stayed with the disciples in Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He immediately started to preach about Jesus in the synagogues, saying, “This is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who heard him was astonished and said, “This is the man who harassed those who were calling on Jesus’ name in Jerusalem, isn’t it? Didn’t he come here to bring them in chains to the high priests?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul grew more and more persuasive, and continued to confound the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that this man was the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After several days had gone by, the Jewish leaders plotted to murder Saul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but their plot became known to him. They were even watching the gates day and night to murder him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but his disciples took him one night and let him down through the city wall by lowering him in a basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Saul arrived in Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they all were afraid of him because they wouldn’t believe he was a disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barnabas, however, introduced Saul to the apostles, telling them how on the road Saul had seen the Lord, who had spoken to him, and how courageously he had spoken in the name of Jesus in Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he freely circulated among them in Jerusalem, speaking courageously in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He kept talking and arguing with the Hellenistic Jews, but they were bent on murdering him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the brothers found out about the plot, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria enjoyed peace. As it continued to be built up and to live in the fear of the Lord, it kept increasing in numbers through the encouragement of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Peter was going around among all of the disciples, he also visited the saints living in Lydda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There he found a man named Aeneas who was paralyzed and had been bedridden for eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter told him, “Aeneas, Jesus the Messiah is healing you. Get up and put away your mat!” At once he got up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the people who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha, which in Greek is Dorcas. She was known for her good actions and acts of charity that she was always doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, she got sick and died. After they had washed her, they laid her in an upstairs room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples heard that Peter was there and sent two men to him and begged him, “Come here quickly!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter got up and went with them. When he arrived, they took him upstairs. All the widows gathered around Peter, crying and showing him all the shirts and coats Dorcas had made while she was still with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter made them all go outside. After kneeling down, he prayed, turned to the body, and said, “Tabitha, get up!” She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He extended his hand and helped her get up. Then he called the saints, including the widows, and gave her back to them alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What happened became known throughout Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Peter stayed in Joppa for several days with Simon, a leatherworker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in what was known as the Italian Regiment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a devout man who feared God, as did everyone in his home. He gave many gifts to the poor among the people and always prayed to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, about three in the afternoon, he had a vision and clearly saw an angel of God coming to him and saying to him, “Cornelius!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stared at the angel in terror and asked, “What is it, Lord?”
The angel answered him, “Your prayers and your gifts to the poor have arisen as a reminder to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send men now to Joppa and summon Simon, who is called Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is a guest of Simon, a leatherworker, whose house is by the sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angel who had spoken to him had gone, Cornelius summoned two of his household servants and a devout soldier, one of those who served him regularly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He explained everything to them and sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Around noon the next day, while they were on their way and coming close to the town, Peter went up on the roof to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He became very hungry and wanted to eat, and while the food was being prepared, he fell into a trance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw heaven open and something like a large linen sheet coming down, being lowered by its four corners to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In it were all kinds of four-footed animals, reptiles, and birds of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a voice told him, “Get up, Peter! Kill something and eat it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Absolutely not, Lord, for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the voice came to him a second time, “You must stop calling unclean what God has made clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times. Then the sheet was quickly taken back into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was still at a loss to know what the vision he had seen could mean, the men sent by Cornelius asked for Simon’s house and went to the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They called out and asked if Simon who was called Peter was staying there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter was still thinking about the vision when the Spirit told him, “Look! Three men are looking for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up, go downstairs, and don’t hesitate to go with them, for I have sent them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter went to the men and said, “I’m the man you’re looking for. Why are you here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men replied, “Cornelius, a centurion and an upright and God-fearing man who is respected by the whole Jewish nation, was instructed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his home to hear what you have to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter welcomed them as his guests. The next day, he got up and went with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa went along with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, they arrived in Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called his relatives and close friends together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter was about to enter, Cornelius met him, bowed down at his feet, and began to worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter made him get up, saying, “Stand up! I, too, am only a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Peter talked with him, he went in and found that many people had gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “You understand how wrong it is for a Jew to associate or visit with unbelievers. But God has shown me that I should stop calling anyone common or unclean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that is why I didn’t hesitate when I was sent for. Now may I ask why you sent for me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cornelius replied, “Four days ago at this very hour, three o’clock in the afternoon, I was praying in my home. All at once a man in radiant clothes stood in front of me
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard. God has remembered your gifts to the poor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so send messengers to Joppa and summon Simon, who is called Peter, to come to you. He is a guest in the home of Simon, a leatherworker, by the sea.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I sent for you immediately, and it was good of you to come. All of us are here now in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has ordered you to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to speak: “Now I understand that God shows no partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, whoever fears him and does what is right is acceptable to him in any nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has sent his word to the descendants of Israel and brought them the good news of peace through Jesus the Messiah. This man is the Lord of everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know what happened throughout Judea, beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John preached.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, and because God was with him, he went around doing good and healing everyone who was oppressed by the Devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are witnesses of everything Jesus did in the land of the Jews, including Jerusalem.
“They hung him on a tree and killed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God raised him on the third day and allowed him to appear—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to all the people, but to us who were chosen by God to be witnesses and who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also ordered us to preach to the people and to testify solemnly that this is the one appointed by God to be the judge of the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the prophets testify to this: everyone who believes in Jesus receives forgiveness of sins through his name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was still making this statement, the Holy Spirit fell on all the people who were listening to his message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the circumcised believers who had come with Peter were amazed that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out on the gentiles, too,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they heard them speaking in foreign languages and praising God. Then Peter said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one can stop us from using water to baptize these people who have received the Holy Spirit in the same way that we did, can they?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter ordered them to be baptized in the name of Jesus the Messiah. Then they asked him to stay there for several days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the apostles and the brothers who were in Judea heard that the gentiles had also accepted the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Peter went up to Jerusalem, those who emphasized circumcision disagreed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to explain to them point by point what had happened. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I was in the town of Joppa praying when in a trance I saw a vision: Something like a large linen sheet descended down from heaven, lowered by its four corners, and it came right down to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I examined it closely, I saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, reptiles, and birds of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also heard a voice telling me, ‘Get up, Peter! Kill something and eat it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I replied, ‘Absolutely not, Lord, for nothing common or unclean has ever entered my mouth!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the voice from heaven answered a second time, ‘You must stop calling common what God has made clean!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times. Then everything was pulled back up to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that very moment three men arrived at the house where we were staying. They had been sent to me from Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit told me to go with them without hesitating. These six brothers went with me, too, and we entered the house of the man from Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told us how he had seen an angel standing in his home and saying, ‘Send messengers to Joppa and summon Simon, who is called Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will discuss with you how you and your entire household will be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them just as he was first given to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I remembered what the Lord had said: ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if God gave them the same gift that he gave us when we believed in the Lord Jesus, the Messiah, who was I to try to stop God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they calmed down, and praised God by saying, “So God has given repentance that leads to life even to gentiles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people who were scattered by the persecution that started because of Stephen went as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But among them were some men from Cyprus and Cyrene, who came to Antioch and began proclaiming the Lord Jesus even to the Hellenistic Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a large number of people believed and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the church in Jerusalem heard this news, they sent Barnabas all the way to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived, he rejoiced to see what the grace of God had done, and with hearty determination he kept encouraging all of them to remain faithful to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and faith. And so a large number of people was brought to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Barnabas left for Tarsus to look for Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he found him, he brought him to Antioch, and for a whole year they were guests of the church and taught many people. It was in Antioch that the disciples were first called Christians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time some prophets from Jerusalem came down to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them named Agabus got up and predicted by the Spirit that there would be a severe famine all over the world. This happened during the reign of Claudius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all of the disciples decided they would send a contribution to the brothers living in Judea, as they were able,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by sending it through Barnabas and Saul to the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About that time, Herod arrested some people who belonged to the church and mistreated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He even had James, the brother of John, killed with a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw how this was agreeable to the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter, too. This happened during the Festival of Unleavened Bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrested Peter, Herod put him in prison and turned him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, planning to bring him out to the people after Passover season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter was kept in prison, but earnest prayer to God for him was being offered by the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That very night, before Herod was going to bring him out, Peter, bound with two chains, was sleeping between two soldiers, and guards in front of the door were watching the prisoners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell. He tapped Peter on his side, woke him up, and said, “Get up quickly!” His chains fell from his wrists.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel told him, “Tuck in your shirt and put on your sandals!” He did this. Then the angel told him, “Put on your coat and follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter went out and began to follow him, not realizing that what was being done by the angel was real; he thought he was seeing a vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They passed the first guard, then the second, and came to the iron gate that led into the city. It opened by itself for them, and they went outside and proceeded one block when the angel suddenly left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came to himself and said, “Now I’m sure that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from Herod and from everything the Jewish people were expecting!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter realized what had happened, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John who was also called Mark, where a large number of people had gathered and were praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he knocked at the outer gate, a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On recognizing Peter’s voice, she was so overjoyed that she didn’t open the gate but ran back inside and announced that Peter was standing at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other people told her, “You’re out of your mind!” But she kept insisting that it was so. Then they said, “It’s his angel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Peter kept on knocking and knocking. When they opened the gate, they saw him and were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He motioned to them with his hand to be quiet, and then he told them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. He added, “Tell this to James and the brothers.” Then he left and went somewhere else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When morning came, there was a great commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod searched for him but didn’t find him, so he questioned the guards and ordered them to be executed. Then he left Judea, went down to Caesarea, and stayed there for a while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Herod had been in a violent quarrel with the people of Tyre and Sidon. So they came to him as a group. After they had won over Blastus, who oversaw security for the king’s sleeping quarters, they asked for a peace agreement because their country depended on the king’s country for food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, at a set time Herod put on his royal robes, sat down on the royal seat, and made a speech to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people kept shouting, “This is the voice of a god, not of a man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the angel of the Lord struck him down because he did not give glory to God, and he was eaten by worms and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of God continued to grow and spread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Barnabas and Saul had fulfilled their mission, they returned from Jerusalem, bringing with them John (who was also called Mark).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius from Cyrene, Manaen, who grew up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul were prophets and teachers in the church at Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set Barnabas and Saul apart for me to do the work for which I called them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they fasted and prayed, laid their hands on them, and let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had been sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went to Seleucia and from there sailed to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arriving in Salamis, they began to preach God’s word in the Jewish synagogues. They also had John to help them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went through the whole island as far as Paphos, where they found a Jewish occult practitioner and false prophet named Bar-jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was associated with the proconsul Sergius Paulus, who was an intelligent man. He sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Elymas the occult practitioner (that is the meaning of his name) continued to oppose them and tried to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul, also known as Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked him straight in the eye
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “You’re full of every form of deception and trickery, you son of the Devil, you enemy of all that is right! You’ll never stop perverting the straight ways of the Lord, will you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is against you now, and you’ll be blind and unable to see the sun for a while!” At that moment a dark mist came over him, and he went around looking for someone to lead him by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, because he was astonished at the Lord’s teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul and his men set sail from Paphos and arrived in Perga in Pamphylia, where John left them and went back to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Perga and arrived in Antioch in Pisidia. On the Sabbath day, they went into the synagogue and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the synagogue leaders asked them, “Brothers, if you have any message of encouragement for the people, you may speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Paul stood up, motioned with his hand, and said:
“Men of Israel and you who fear God, listen!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of this people Israel chose our ancestors and made them a great people during their stay in the land of Egypt, and with a public display of power he led them out of there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had put up with them for 40 years in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan. Then God gave their land to the Israelis as an inheritance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for about 450 years.
“After that, he gave them judges until the time of the prophet Samuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they demanded a king, God gave them Kish’s son Saul, from the tribe of Benjamin, for 40 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God removed Saul and made David their king, about whom he testified, ‘I have found that David, the son of Jesse, is a man after my own heart, who will carry out all my wishes.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was from this man’s descendants that God, as he promised, brought to Israel a Savior, who is Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before Jesus’ appearance, John had already preached a baptism of repentance to all the people in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John was finishing his work, he said, ‘Who do you think I am? I’m not the Messiah. No, but he is coming after me, and I’m not worthy to untie the sandals on his feet.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My brothers, descendants of Abraham’s family, and those among you who fear God, it is to us that the message of this salvation has been sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the people who live in Jerusalem and their leaders, not knowing who Jesus was, condemned him and so fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although they found no reason to sentence him to death, they asked Pilate to have him executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had finished doing everything that was written about him, they took him down from the tree and placed him in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised him from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for many days he appeared to those who had come with him to Jerusalem from Galilee. These are now his witnesses to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We’re telling you the good news: What God promised our ancestors
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he has fulfilled for us, their descendants, by raising Jesus. As it is written in the second Psalm, ‘You are my Son. Today I have become your Father.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God raised him from the dead, never to experience decay, as he said, ‘I’ll give you the holy promises made to David.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In another Psalm he says, ‘You will not let your Holy One experience decay.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David, after he had served God’s purpose in his own generation, died and was buried with his ancestors, and so he experienced decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the man whom God raised did not experience decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, brothers, you must understand that through him the forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that everyone who believes in him is justified and freed from everything that kept you from being justified by the Law of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be careful that what the prophets said doesn’t happen to you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Look, you mockers!
    Be amazed and die!
Since I am performing an action in your days,
    one that you would not believe
        even if someone told you!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving, the people kept urging them to tell them the same things the next Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the meeting of the synagogue broke up, many Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who kept talking to them and urging them to continue in the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next Sabbath almost the whole town gathered to hear the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jewish leaders saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy and began to object to the statements made by Paul and even to abuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul and Barnabas boldly declared, “We had to speak God’s word to you first, but since you reject it and consider yourselves unworthy of eternal life, we are now going to turn to the gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For that is what the Lord ordered us to do: ‘I have made you a light to the gentiles to be the means of salvation to the very ends of the earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the gentiles heard this, they began rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord. Meanwhile, all who had been destined to eternal life believed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the word of the Lord began to spread throughout the whole region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jewish leaders stirred up devout women of high social standing and the officials in the city, started a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out of their territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul and Barnabas shook the dust off their feet in protest against them and went to Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the disciples continued to be full of joy and the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Iconium, Paul and Barnabas went into the Jewish synagogue and spoke in such a way that a great number of both Jews and Greeks believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stayed there a considerable time and continued to speak boldly for the Lord, who kept affirming his word of grace and granting signs and wonders to be done by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people of the city were divided. Some were with the Jews, while others were with the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator
